title: No ads, but unresponsive with big files
comment: It has no ads, making it a good choice for small files. Unfortunately, it becomes unresponsive dealing with bigger files (about over 50kB makes it sluggish).

title: One King/MUST HAVE feature, 1st I tried & it was there
comment: Don't get hopes too high, I'm looking for best text, including programming with bonus for special support for as many languages as possible, also extensibility would be big key. However two pro-editors already failed on this that you did right. I'm talking of failing to keep your file(s) open between switching application, then returning to editor. Amazing, but it seems most authors never consider that users multitask, nor even that sudden call also switches from editor task, and then back to it.

title: Perfect
comment: This is a simple text editor. It works and there aren't ads. Love it.

title: Replaced Jota
comment: I don't really edit files over 500kb. This editor small really does the things I need most, like auto-save and white on black theme. When editing text files, I'm usually jumping in and out of top, mid, and bottom. Jota is great and I wish Ted had more features like Jota, but Jota was just getting too slow and clunky. Now Jota has been replaced. Sorry

title: First of a few that retains line breaks when syncing to Windows PC
comment: I wanted to sync .txt files using dropbox, but whenever I edited them on my phone with the built-in app or other apps I've tried, the line breaks were gone when I re-opened the file on my PC.  This is the first app of a few I've tested that retains the line breaks, so I'm happy :)

comment: Ted is fully supported by talkback for the blind and it will be more awesum if it opens and edits very large text files as well.

title: Great app
comment: Lightweight and functional, i programmed a 3d game from scratch using this, those bulky features arent worth the computing expense to me. Would give 5 stars for a snap-to zoom feature though instead of manually increasing font size, maybe a pinch type UI would be sweet. No extra features though just that :-)

title: Basic but brilliant.
comment: A good, lightweight text editor without any unnecessary "bells and whistles". The app's simple design and spartan feature-set is particularly well-suited to small screens, such as those of smartphones and phablets. The app is open-source, ad-free, and permission-lite, as described.

title: Best
comment: Dowmloaded many editors but this one is that rly helped me so much, Thanks.
Non responsive app.

title: Good Potential, Irritating Deficiencies
comment: I've used it to open some huge files, and the settings are comprehensive, and I like the Recent Files.  It handles RTL (Arabic) well.  OTOH, I can either select one word, or the whole document, nothing in between.  Refreshing lines under edits often gets scrambled.  Sometimes the positioning of edits changes wildly.  Worst: no concept of current working directory, so every time I open, or saves as, requires a new navigation down to where I'm working.  These are all for small files.

title: Simple and solid
comment: This is a simple, solid basic word processor. It's a good way to take notes and even share them with other android apps.

title: Simple text editor
comment: It does what it is many to do.  Nothing fancy, just a simple text editor.  Great for viewing text documents, jotting down a few notes, ...

title: Works well

Ted is a reasonably fast plain-text editing program.  I really like it except for one small problem.  I want tab on my keyboard to tab over in the program.  Seriously, this is the biggest problem I have with this or any other program on my Android tablet.

title: Perfect text editor
comment: I was looking for a lightweight text editor that has a search function within the file, and this is the best I have tried. Other apps imported the text file into their own directory and do not save it where it was originally stored. This app edits the actual file either in my internal storage or external card, which is what I needed. Other functions I like are that it highlights the line where the cursor is, has undo, and the prompt when you press back.  I won't change a thing about this app.
Simple. Does what it should. Just great.

title: Though a simple one it's so wonderful

title: Great but one big bug

title: pretty snappy

title: Can't auto-wrap text
comment: In looking for a low-footprint text editor, I accept (even expect) that it can't hold -nearly- a million characters. I mean, I just want to be able to record in my journal while traveling without worrying about running out of power. No journal entry is -nearly- that long. But text-wrapping is still a very basic thing to text editing.

Hi, there is an option in the Settings (use menu, Settings, then check the "Word Wrap' box). This should make all lines wrap at the border of the screen. If this doesn't work please let me know and I'll check this.

Hi, 
As stated in the description of Ted on the Market, this app is not meant to deal with large text files but only small texts. I'm really sorry for any data loss you may have had.

Always liked this little editor and is just what my device needed: as the description states, a "lightweight Notepad-style text editor not meant for large documents." Has a small footprint yet still provides the essentials needed for basic text creation/modification. It is NOT a substitute for a full blown word processor like MS Word nor does it claim to be. The 5★'s is based on how it performs relative to the description – on that basis it actually exceeds expectations. Wishlist: a few more text/background color combinations would be nice.

title: Failure
comment: At first, this looks like a good editor, as it handles Word files, fonts and formatting well.  As an editor, it failes. I can't auto-wrap the text when I'm editing (except where keyboard forces that, which doesn't show fonts)  For actual text files it can't display Unicode files correctly, and forget editing those.  For new text files (jotting some notes or whatever) it loses all edit from the last save if you switch screens or a call comes in, so it's only good as a bloated reader.  I switched to Jota+
